definitions.title: n.pr. 1. loc.
definitions.body: a distant port, site not certainly known (Wkl:Altor. Forsch. v. 445); most Tartessues in Spain Thes (after older authorities) Ges:Is i. 719 Mey:Gesch. d. Alt. i, § 281; other views are: Tyrseni (Etruscans) in Italy, WMM:Hast. DB TARSHISH, Phoenicia Renouf:PSBA xvi. 134 ff., Sardinia Hal:REJ xiii. 14; v. also Ency. Bib.:TARSHISH;—Tarshish, LXX usu. Qars(e)iv (Is 23:1, Is 23:14 Karxh/dwn = Carthage);—esp. in phr. ´[[אֳנִיּוֹת ת]]: Tarshish-ships (large, sea-going vessels, fit to ply to Tarshish) Is 2:16 (LXX ploi=on qala/sshv), Is 23:1, Is 23:14, Is 60:9, Ez Eze 27:25, 1Ki 22:49, ‖ 2Ch 20:36, 2Ch 20:37 (where the ships go to ´[[ת]]:); ´[[אֳנִי ת]]: 1Ki 10:22, 1Ki 10:22 ‖ 2Ch 9:21 ([[אֳנִיּוֹת]]), + v:2Ch 9:21; (ships go to ´[[ת]]:); ´[[ת]]: alone Is 23:6, Jon 1:3, Jon 1:3, Jon 4:2 (all c. [[ה]] loc.), Ge 10:4 ‖ 1Ch 1:7 (erron. [[ה]] loc.), Is 66:19, Ps 72:10, Jon 1:3; ´[[בַּת־ת]]: Is 23:10; trading-port Ez Eze 27:12, Eze 38:13, whence comes silver Je 10:9.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: Persian noble Es 1:14; expl. By Scheft:53 as OIran. tṛšus, ‘der Gierige.’
